body_html:
The reason I renamed these components is because there is a new rule in airbnb that disallows importing the default export as a name of the other export. As an example, if you have a module foo.js.

export const FOO = 0;

export default function() { return FOO }

then it is a lint error to, in another file

import FOO from './foo.js';

It is confusing to import something by the name FOO that isn't FOO. I think it matters less in our case, but I tried to not change too many lint rules.
